question: Match the hormone with its site of production:
Hormone: a. hCG and hPL, b. Progesterone, c. Androgens, d. Relaxin
Site: i. Ovary, ii. Placenta, iii. Corpus luteum, iv. Leydig cells
explanation: hCG and hPL are produced by the Placenta (ii); Progesterone is produced by the Corpus luteum (iii); Androgens are secreted by Leydig cells (iv); and Relaxin is produced by the Ovary (i) [cite: 25-42, 474].
